About Me

Hi, my name is Ka I (pronounced ‚Äúe‚Äù) Chan, a Master‚Äôs student in Data Science and Information Technology at Tsinghua University. I am grateful to be advised by Prof. Yuanchun Shi and Prof. Yuntao Wang. I have also been fortunate to work with Prof. Xuhai ‚ÄúOrson‚Äù Xu, Prof. Zhicong Lu, Prof. Saeed Abdullah, and Prof. Jiangtao Gong. Previously, I graduated magna cum laude from Tsinghua University with a B.S. in Psychology.

My research interests lie at the intersection of HCI, health and wellbeing, accessibility and aging. I focus on understanding the needs and challenges of vulnerable and marginalized populations and on designing and building systems to empower and enhance their quality of life.

In my daily life, I enjoy various sports and have a passion on music. I used to play the piano and guitar and was a percussion member of the Tsinghua University Symphonic Band. Currently, I am self-teaching the ukulele :)

My CV is available here.

Projects & Publication

  1. Hemifacial Spasm Patients' Top-Tier Medical Resource Seeking in China from an Actor-Network Perspective
    Ka I Chan, Yuntao Wang, and etc.
    Submitted to CHI 2025.
  2. Automated Grading Hemifacial Spasm Using Smartphone Camera
    Ka I Chan*, Bo Hei*, Linghao Meng*, and etc.
    Submitted to IEEE International Conference on Ubiquitous Intelligence and Computing (UIC 2024).
  3. Beyond Digital Privacy: Uncovering Deeper Attitudes toward Privacy in Home Camera among Older Adults
    Weiwei Zhang, Jianing Yin, Ka I Chan, and etc.
    International Journal of Human Computer Studies, 2024.
  4. Lookine: Non-Verbal Social Assistance and Learning System for Blind People
    Lookine aims to help blind individuals in social interactions through voice interaction and visual recognition technology.
  5. Impact of LED Masks on People‚Äôs Communication
    Explored correlation between LED mask usage and improved daily communication effectiveness, aiming to support individuals with hearing impairments.
  6. Influence of Environmental Color on Taste Perception
    Explored intermodal perception of vision and taste, aiding individuals with eating disorders in forming healthy diets. Received the second-largest funding from Tsinghua Student Research Plan.
